item.title: U.N. agency says six of its staff among those killed in Israeli strikes
item.dc:creator: Frances Vinall, Victoria Bisset
item.description: The workers were killed when two airstrikes hit a Gaza refugee camp, said UNRWA, the U.N. agency for Palestinian refugees. Israel said it was targeting Hamas militants.

item.title: More than half of Brazil is wracked by drought. Blame deforestation.
item.dc:creator: Terrence McCoy
item.description: Latin America’s largest country is being baked by its worst drought on record.

item.title: Iran turns to Hells Angels and other criminal gangs to target critics
item.dc:creator: Greg Miller, Souad Mekhennet, Cate Brown
item.description: Iran has cultivated ties with criminal networks in the West to carry out a recent wave of violent plots in the United States and Europe.

item.title: Which countries have suspended or restricted arms sales to Israel?
item.dc:creator: Niha Masih, Leo Sands
item.description: The U.K. is the latest country to suspend some weapons exports, amid scrutiny over military aid to Israel as the war in Gaza nears the one-year mark.

item.title: Amid Gaza talks, U.S. releases $1.3 billion in military aid to Egypt
item.dc:creator: Missy Ryan, Abigail Hauslohner
item.description: The Biden administration had previously withheld some annual funding from Egypt amid scrutiny of its human rights record.

item.title: New video, witnesses challenge Israel’s account of U.S. activist’s killing
item.dc:creator: Miriam Berger, Loveday Morris, Meg Kelly, Jarrett Ley, Sufian Taha
item.description: The IDF said Aysenur Eygi was shot “unintentionally” during a “violent riot.” A Post analysis shows clashes had subsided and protesters had retreated.

item.title: Biden ‘outraged’ by U.S. activist’s death; Israel kills dozens in Gaza strikes
item.dc:creator: Francesca Ebel, Leo Sands, Heba Farouk Mahfouz
item.description: Israel carried out at least four airstrikes in Gaza and mounted raids in two West Bank villages.

item.title: As U.S. and Ukraine debate arms restrictions, Blinken visits Kyiv
item.dc:creator: Michael Birnbaum, Siobhán O'Grady, Ellen Francis
item.description: Kyiv’s attempt to sway the Biden administration comes as Ukraine has faced heavy bombardment from Russia in recent days — especially on its power sector.

item.title: Trump debate claims about German energy policy are wrong, says Berlin
item.dc:creator: Kate Brady
item.description: “We are shutting down — not building — coal and nuclear plants,” Germany’s Foreign Ministry said on social media in response to Trump’s debate comments.

item.title: House GOP maneuvers to portray Democrats as weak on China
item.dc:creator: Abigail Hauslohner, Cate Cadell, Marianna Sotomayor
item.description: With its “China Week” blitz of legislation, the House GOP seeks to bolster the party’s foreign policy credentials ahead of November’s election.

item.title: Global outlets pick apart debate, with many saying Harris came out on top
item.dc:creator: Adela Suliman
item.description: Reactions to the Trump-Harris debate showed how closely countries are watching for signs of how November’s presidential election could affect their U.S. ties.

item.title: Meet Margarita Simonyan, queen of Russia’s covert information wars
item.dc:creator: Robyn Dixon
item.description: While the Kremlin has denied U.S. accusations of information operations, Simonyan proudly admits that her work is at the behest of the Russian government.

item.title: Mexican lawmakers flee protesters, pass contentious judges law
item.dc:creator: Mary Beth Sheridan
item.description: The constitutional amendment would give citizens the power to choose nearly all judges. Diplomats, business leaders and legal scholars have expressed alarm.

item.title: How Harris and Trump answered foreign policy questions during the debate
item.dc:creator: Rachel Pannett, Niha Masih, Kelly Kasulis Cho
item.description: Vice President Kamala Harris and former president Donald Trump debated China ties, Russia’s invasion of Ukraine, the war in Gaza and the exit from Afghanistan.

item.title: Afghan women endure draconian Taliban, 23 years after 9/11
item.dc:creator: Ishaan Tharoor
item.description: The plight of Afghanistan’s women in 2024 provides a grim coda to the saga of the U.S.’s role in the country since 2001. It’s a tale of tragedy and hubris, misadventures and corruption, and — in the final, bleak reckoning — a tale of failure.

item.title: U.S. demands IDF change West Bank operations after American’s killing
item.dc:creator: Karen DeYoung, Michael Birnbaum, Loveday Morris
item.description: Secretary of State Antony Blinken’s comments were the strongest yet from a U.S. official after the Israeli military said it was “highly likely” it “unintentionally” killed Aysenur Eygi.

item.title: Israeli strike kills 19 in Gaza humanitarian area, health officials say
item.dc:creator: Francesca Ebel, Kelly Kasulis Cho, Hajar Harb, Jennifer Hassan, Hazem Balousha
item.description: Gazan authorities reported deaths after missiles struck Mawasi, a safe zone designated for displaced people. The IDF said it was targeting Hamas militants.

item.title: U.S. accuses Iran of sending ballistic missiles to Russia
item.dc:creator: Michael Birnbaum, Siobhán O'Grady
item.description: Tehran has sent missiles to Russia, Secretary of State Antony Blinken said, escalating the conflict in Ukraine and exacerbating tensions with the West.

item.title: Man accused of setting Olympic runner on fire also dies of burns, hospital says
item.dc:creator: Annabelle Timsit, Katharine Houreld, Rael Ombuor
item.description: A hospital in Kenya said Dickson Ndiema, the ex-boyfriend of runner Rebecca Cheptegei, died of burns sustained during his alleged fire attack after the Paris Olympics.

item.title: Apple, Google must pay billions in back taxes and fines, E.U. court rules
item.dc:creator: Ellen Francis, Cat Zakrzewski
item.description: The European Court of Justice said Apple must repay about $14.35 billion after reaping illegal tax benefits in Ireland and backed a $2.65 billion antitrust fine on Google.

item.title: Dozens dead after Typhoon Yagi makes landfall in Vietnam
item.dc:creator: Leo Sands
item.description: Dozens of people were dead or missing after Typhoon Yagi struck, triggering heavy rains and landslides. A steel bridge collapsed as a result of the flooding.
